________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       75 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 Test Configuration for the UC-Plane 1 
The TER shown in Figure 2.1-1 provides M-Plane and S-Plane commands and sequences to correctly set up the O-RU 2 
for testing using the fronthaul connection – meaning a criterion and prerequisite for executing all UC-Plane tests is 3 
proper operation of the O-RU’s synchronization and M-Plane capabilities.  The TER provides the specific C-Plane and 4 
U-Plane data flows and collects data from the radiated energy from the O-RU and evaluates based on the collected RF 5 
energy whether the O-RU correctly received and interpreted the fronthaul DL data flow.  For many tests a single RF 6 
detector is satisfactory to detect the radiated signal but for beamforming tests an RF pattern must be measured to 7 
validate the correct beam is being generated according to the C-Plane commands and U-Plane data flowing across the 8 
fronthaul interface. 9 
In addition, the TER generates RF energy using the signal generator and feeds it to the O-RU’s antennas (or antenna 10 
connectors) which is expected to be used by the O-RU, in conjunction with the C-Plane UL commands sent by the TER 11 
over the fronthaul connection, to generate UL data flows on the fronthaul connection which are received and evaluated 12 
by the TER.  For almost all tests a single RF emitter is satisfactory to generate the radiated signal, even beamforming 13 
tests wherein the received power level will validate that the beam main lobe was correctly specified across the fronthaul 14 
interface, except for the case of uplink channel-information-based beamforming tests where multiple RF emitters are 15 
needed to emulate multiple uplink spatial streams. 16 
3GPP-specified tests will be used here to simplify the testing, because such tests will need to be supported by the O-RU 17 
anyway for 3GPP conformance testing.  The specific test cases identify where this is possible and where changes must 18 
be made to adequately test O-RAN features. 19 
Note that when testing the O-RU for fronthaul interface conformance, much more than the fronthaul interface is being 20 
tested, indeed the entire O-RU is under test, including digital and analog processing having nothing to do with the 21 
fronthaul interface.  Therefore a “passed” test can be interpreted with some confidence as indicating a properly 22 
operating fronthaul interface, but a “failed” test may indicate a problem with the fronthaul interface or with some other 23 
operation within the O-RU therefore failed tests may require some troubleshooting.  While 3GPP TS 38.141-1, TS 24 
38.141-2 [NR] and TS 36.141 [LTE] describes the basic waveform used in these tests it does not describe how the 25 
various channels should be put into O-RAN sections.  The 3GPP TS 38.141-1 NR-FR1-TM1.1 [NR FR1], TS 38.141-2 26 
NR-FR2-TM1.1 [NR FR2], and TSTS 36.141 E-TM1.1 [LTE] signals are tightly packed with data.  All tests will divide 27 
that data into “stock” data sections using the sections described below.  To expedite the definition and creation of the 28 
tests, a set of standard test environments and patterns is defined in this section.  This includes a “stock” arrangement of 29 
data sections in DL (same is used for UL) which can be used regardless of the specific bandwidth and SCS used in the 30 
test.  Specifically, there are “stock” 1-symbol, 2-symbol, and 3-symbol data section sets that shall be cited in test 31 
definitions (numbered “A” through “F”) that will support various test cases.  The test cases are expected to specify the 32 
data section definition of a test slot and all slots are expected to follow the same data section definition unless a test 33 
specifically states otherwise.  In many cases only some symbols within a slot will be subject to testing; the remaining 34 
symbols are expected to remain undefined for the test and may have data sections defined according to the normal 35 
operation of the O-DU (e.g. set to carry synch or reference signals consistent with LTE or NR).  In cases where a 36 
specific type of data section cannot be supported by the DUT, then that data section is omitted in the symbol(s) and the 37 
corresponding U-Plane data shall be set to zero in DL (and arranged to have no RF power in UL).  Figure 3.2.1.1-2 38 
shows the “stock” data section definition. 39 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       76 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
“stock” data section definitions A-F:A: 1 symbol 1 section only : simplest caseB: 1 symbol 2 sections : slightly more complexC: 1 symbol 2 sections w/ gap : tests ability to handle data gapsD: 1 symbol many sections : tests single-PRB section, rb bit, use of non-all-ones reMask, many data sectionsE: 2 symbol 2 sections : tests multi-symbol section, symInc bitF: 3 symbols many sections : tests data gaps, reMask, multi-symbol sectionsArrows mark end-of-symbol for various SCS and  (max=273)A: 1 section ………..B: 2 sections ………… … ……D: 6 sections……….* * * *C: 2 sections w/ gap**E: 2 symbols2 sections ……….F: 3 symbolscomplex …………* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * ** marks PRBs with reMask NOT all ones** white-colored PRBs represent empty PRBs
  1 
Figure 3.2.1.1-2 Stock Data Section Definition for both DL and UL 2 
 3 
There is also “stock” U-Plane data that is PN23 data, representing user data prior to modulation, as specified within 4 
3GPP 38.14138.141-1[CCITT Recommendation O.151 (10/92): https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-O.151-199210-I/en] 5 
which is assumed to start at a frame boundary and be identical in all frames in both DL and UL, unless a specific test 6 
states differently.  The PN sequence is expected to be running for the duration of the frame for whatever is the 7 
bandwidth and SCS (this is different from how the data sections are handled, wherein the data sections are truncated 8 
based on the number of PRBs per symbol).  However, in many cases only some symbols within a frame will be actually 9 
subject to testing (as defined by the specific tests) so will contain the test PN sequence data; the remaining symbols are 10 
expected to remain undefined for the test and may contain data according to the normal operation of the O-DU (e.g. set 11 
to carry synch or reference signals consistent with LTE or NR).  Note that the PN sequence initial value is provided by 12 
a seed which may be included as a Test Command parameter. If the parameter is omitted the PN sequence generator 13 
will use a “seed” value of all ones. 14 
For all tests, the test definition shall define the specific slots and symbols subject to test (carrying the “stock” C-Plane 15 
data section definition and the “stock” U-Plane data) with the remaining slots and symbols carrying normal 3GPP synch 16 
and control data and either allocated user data according to 3GPP or left empty (i.e. no user data allocated).  All slots 17 
and symbols subject to test are identical in each frame, so tests do not have to wait for a specific frame number and are 18 
not expected to reset or otherwise perturb the normal frame number sequence.  This is intended to allow the test to 19 
disrupt normal O-DU and O-RU operation as little as possible. If there is a specific need to validate the construction of 20 
a specific frame or slot of data, a test may elect to zero the test data and leave undefined the data sections for all except 21 
one slot or frame of data; where this is necessary it will be described in the specific test definition, but this is expected 22 
to be an exceptional case. 23 
 Generic Steps for Test Execution, O-RU TEST SCENARIO 24 
The following are the generic test steps used when testing the O-RU, although specific tests may deviate from this 25 
general procedure: 26 
1) Configure the Test Equipment, O-RU (TER) for test execution, which may include defining the specific test to 27 
execute. This may also include using a scripting language for describing the test. 28 
2) Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 29 
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1. 30 
3) Send appropriate C-Plane and U-Plane DL data flows and collect the O-RU radiated energy (or collect from 31 
antenna connectors) using RF detection equipment. 32 
4) Evaluate the RF energy pattern from the O-RU to determine if the O-RU correctly received and interpreted the 33 
fronthaul C-Plane and U-Plane data flows.  In some cases, it also includes decoding and demodulating the RF 34 
signal to ensure all UC-Plane messages were interpreted correctly. 35 
5) Send appropriate C-Plane messages to define the desired UL U-Plane flow, at the same time cause the RF 36 
signal generator to radiate (or feed into antenna connectors) the appropriate RF energy pattern for the test.  37 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       77 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
This also means meeting the appropriate timing windows to allow the O-RU to decode and process the C-1 
Plane messages before the signal generator starts sending RF. 2 
6) Collect the O-RU UL data flows on the fronthaul interface and evaluate for correctness; this will generally be 3 
U-Plane data only but in limited cases (LAA) may include UL C-Plane messages too. 4 
7) Since FDD uplink and TDD tests require tight timing constraints between the components of the TER it is 5 
recommended that CUSM emulator signal the RF test equipment when C-Plane signalling has started for a 6 
frame.  How this signal is used by the RF test equipment to synchronize transmission and reception is 7 
implementation dependant. 8 
 9 
 10 
 UC-Plane Measurements, O-DU Test Scenario 11 
For future study. 12 
3.2.2 Minimum Capabilities of the TER for U-Plane and C-Plane Tests 13 
Since many features of the O-RAN protocol rely on the O-DU instructing the O-RU to put data in specific resource 14 
blocks using a specific compression method it is imperative that the test equipment support features that allow 15 
comparing data on the fronthaul side with data on the RF side of the radio. 16 
 Signal Analyzer 17 
 Must have the capability of decoding and demodulating an RF signal either received over the air or on a 18 
conducted interface.  This data must be made available for comparison with data sent on the fronthaul 19 
interface. 20 
 Must be able to determine the Phase and amplitude of any signal for beamforming tests. 21 
 Obviously must support the frequency range of the radio being tested. 22 
 Signal Generator 23 
 Must provide software capable of building a correct 5G or LTE waveform. 24 
 Should have the ability to automatically build 3GPP compliant test waveforms and should provide a 25 
mechanism for editing the parameters of that waveform. 26 
 Must be able to be synchronized with the O-DU emulator to ensure proper timing of uplink C-Plane and U-27 
Plane messages 28 
 CUSM-Plane Emulator (CUSM-E) 29 
 Must be able to extract IQ data from uplink U-Plane messages and demodulate and decode the data to ensure it 30 
is the same as what was commanded in the uplink C-Plane messages. 31 
 Must have the ability to synchronize with the RF signal source. 32 
 Should have the ability to perform as a PTP Master or subordinate depending on the synchronization 33 
configuration the radio supports. 34 
 Must have the ability to accept frequency domain IQ and encapsulate it according to user input on the correct 35 
sections. 36 
 37 
3.2.3 FR1 FDD Conducted-Signal Tests  38 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class NR testing Generic (NRG)  39 
Note that all downlink tests in this section use a 3GPP test wave form with 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz 40 
Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP 38.141 -1 NR-FR1-TM1.1 and section 3.2.1.1.5 of this document.  There are 41 
several variations on this test signal depending on the capabilities of the radio.  If the radio does not support the 42 
numerology used in the example tests as reported in the M-plane it will be up to the test developer to modify their tests 43 
to adapt to the radio.  This can usually be accomplished by using stock test patters described above.  The test is 44 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       78 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
expected to follow the same spirit as the tests in this document but things like symbol numbers, number of PRBs, etc. 1 
may have to be changed. 2 
All uplink tests in this section use a 3GPP test waveform described in 38.141-1 section A1, in particular G-FR1-A5-1 3 
(30 kHz subcarrier spacing, QPSK, 100 MHz BW). As with downlink tests if the radio does not support this signal it is 4 
up to the test developer to modify the parameters of the test without changing the spirit of the test. 5 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Base 3GPP DL 6 
A. Test Description and Applicability 7 
This test is MANDATORY. 8 
 9 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the most basic downlink requirements for O-RAN fronthaul.  10 
Subsequent tests will build on this to exercise additional capabilities of the Fronthaul. 11 
 12 
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 13 
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 14 
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-1. 15 
 16 
 17 
Figure 3.2.3.1-1  NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 18 
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the 19 
remaining PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. This configuration corresponds 20 
to stock data section A (Section 3.2.1.1.5 above) in all symbols that do not contain PDCCH channels. If the radio 21 
does not support the numerology described in section 3.2.3.1 the stock test frames can be adapted for smaller 22 
numbers of PRBs and should still be used. 23 
 24 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit a basic 3GPP test frame using the default parameters in 25 
section 3.2.1.1.5 of this document (or a similar 3GPP waveform) except only one spatial stream on one antenna 26 
will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is required).  As per 27 
TM-FR1-TM1.1 all user data in this test will be zeros. 28 
 29 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 30 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 31 
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New 32 
Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. 33 
 34 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       79 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer.  It must 1 
also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 2 
 3 
C. Test Methodology 4 
1. Initial Conditions 5 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 6 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 7 
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 8 
demodulate the transmitted signal.   9 
2. Procedure 10 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU 11 
emulator.  Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe 12 
the signal. Every symbol should be described by a single section (DL-SCH and DCI) using section type 1 13 
messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane 14 
messages. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  15 
Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to 16 
demodulate and decode the test frame. 17 
 18 
 19 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  20 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 21 
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 22 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it 23 
contains all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the test passes. 24 
 25 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL – Resource allocation 26 
A. Test Description and Applicability 27 
This test is MANDATORY. 28 
 29 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages, 30 
transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the downlink.  This test is 31 
applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is required).  The test will be conducted therefore 32 
there will be no channel distortion or interference.  It is mandatory the radio pass this test to be considered O-RAN 33 
conformant. 34 
  35 
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 36 
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 37 
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-2. 38 
 39 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       80 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1 
 2 Figure 3.2.3.1-2  NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 3 
 4 
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the remaining 5 
PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. This test requires non-zero data (PN23 6 
Sequence)  to populate all allocated resource blocks.  This configuration corresponds to stock data section A in all 7 
symbols that do not contain PDCCH channels. 8 
 9 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 10 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-11 
TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. 12 
 13 
 14 
C. Test Methodology 15 
 16 
a. Initial Conditions 17 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 18 
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 19 
antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 20 
demodulate the transmitted signal.   21 
b. Procedure 22 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  23 
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. 24 
Every symbol should be described by a single section (DL-SCH and DCI) using section type 1 messages. The 25 
data in the sections must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. No section type zero messages 26 
will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages. Play those messages to the O-RU 27 
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times 28 
required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame. 29 
 30 
 31 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  32 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 33 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 34 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       81 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 1 
all the same PRB assignments and data, the test passes. 2 
 3 
 UC Plane O-RU Base Class FDD Test UL 4 
A. Test Description and Applicability 5 
This test is MANDATORY. 6 
 7 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the most basic uplink requirements for O-RAN fronthaul 8 
correctly interpreting C-Plane messages and correctly constructing uplink U-Plane messages from an RF signal. 9 
Subsequent tests will build on this to exercise additional capabilities of the Fronthaul. 10 
 11 
The test validates that correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition 12 
(Section 7.2 TS 38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 38.141) and power 13 
Levels at least 30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 Table 7.2.5-1.  This is to 14 
improve the likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing 15 
receiver sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance.  16 
 17 
 18  19 
Figure 3.2.3.1-3  G-FR1-A5-1 Uplink FDD Test Signal 20 
 21 
This signal is described by table A.1-1 in 3GPP 38.141-1 and is referred to as G-FR1-A1-5 with the power increased 22 
to up to 30 dB above that described in Table 7.2.5-1.  Under those conditions, a 3GPP compliant O-RU should 23 
deliver uplink U-Plane information that matches the uplink signal.  24 
 25 
The TER (Test Equipment, O-RU) generates an uplink signal on the antenna connector or TAB connector, together 26 
with the corresponding C-Plane messages on the Fronthaul interface. 27 
 28 
The TER will capture the U-Plane messages generated by the DUT and validate whether the payload matches the 29 
uplink signal.  30 
 31 
It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 32 
 Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 33 
 Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 34 
 Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 35 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       82 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 2 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 3 
30 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP TS 38.141-1 section G-FR1-A-5.  4 
It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. Note 5 
this signal may be changed to any of the 3GPP sensitivity test signals in table A.1-1 in 3GPP TS 38.141-1 if the 6 
radio does not support the numerology and bandwidth used in this test.  The test signal described in this section will 7 
be used if the radio supports that numerology and bandwidth. 8 
C. Test Methodology 9 
Leverage from the well-known payload (PN23 sequence) of the uplink signal to compare it with the payload of the 10 
signal communicated on the O-RAN interface. The IQ information is extracted from the U-Plane message and 11 
demodulated to retrieve payload.  12 
  13 
a: Initial Conditions 14 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using M-15 
Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna 16 
port and configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon receiving a trigger signal from the 17 
CUSM-E.  The signal source power level should be adjusted to at least 30 dB above the setting used in the 3GPP 18 
receiver sensitivity test. 19 
b: Procedure 20 
 Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS30k_51RB) on the RF Signal Source  21 
 Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a 22 
trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 23 
 Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER)  24 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  25 
 Launch test to play the RF uplink frame after the C-Plane messages have been sent honoring timing 26 
windows  27 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna port  28 
 Extract IQ information  29 
 Extract Payload 30 
 Compare payload binary sequences  31 
  32 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  33 
1. The verdict is “Test pass” if the payload binary sequences match between the uplink test frame sent to the 34 
DUT and the received U-Plane data from the DUT 35 
2. If any of the test conditions are not true, the verdict for the whole test is "Fail" 36 
 37 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using RB Parameter 3GPP DL – Resource 38 
Allocation 39 
A. Test Description and Applicability 40 
This test is MANDATORY. 41 
 42 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 43 
the rb parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the 44 
downlink.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is required).  The test will 45 
be conducted therefore there will be no channel distortion or interference.  It is mandatory the radio pass this test to 46 
be considered O-RAN conformant. 47 
 48 
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 49 
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 50 
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-4. 51 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       83 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1  2 
Figure 3.2.3.1-4  NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 3 
 4 
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the 5 
remaining PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. 6 
 7 
This test requires non-zero data to populate all allocated resource blocks. 8 
 9 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 10 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 11 
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G 12 
New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. The signal analyzer must 13 
have the ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 14 
 15 
C. Test Methodology 16 
a. Initial Conditions 17 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 18 
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 19 
antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 20 
demodulate the transmitted signal.   21 
b. Procedure 22 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  23 
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal.  24 
Every allocated (see below) symbol should be described by sections (DL-SCH and DCI) using section type 1 25 
messages.  No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Symbol #3 of each slot should be Stock 26 
data section “D”  as shown in section 3.2.1.1.5 above. The control plane for symbol #3 will only include PRBs 27 
number 5 through 23. C-Plane messages will have the rb bit set to one for this section. All other DL-SCH 28 
symbols and PRBs other than PRBs 5-23 will either not contain data (i.e. left empty) or contain user data as 29 
defined in the 3GPP NR-FR-TM1.1 FDD test model.  There are two ways to conduct the test: 30 
1. A single data section with the rb bit set and a PN23 sequence sent as shown below: 31 
 32 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       84 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1 
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB will contain only the odd parts of the 2 
PN23 sequence (as shown in green).  The other PRBs (shown in orange) will not contain data and 3 
will not be sent to the O-RU.  Thus, a single data section will be used, and the corresponding U-4 
Plane message will only contain data for the odd PRBs as shown above.  The parts of the PN23 5 
sequence not used (shown marked with an X) will be discarded. 6 
2. Two data sections one containing the odd parts of the PN23 sequence and the other containing the even 7 
parts as shown below: 8 
 9 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       85 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1 
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB in one section will contain only the odd 2 
parts of the PN23 sequence (as shown in green).  The second data section will contain the even 3 
parts of the PN23 sequence.  The C-Plane messages for both sections will use the rb bit. The U-4 
Plane messages corresponding to the first data section will contain only the odd parts of the PN23 5 
sequence, the U-Plane message corresponding to the second data section will only contain the even 6 
parts.  Thus, a continuous PN23 sequence will be sent only in PRBs 5 through 23. 7 
Additional sections should be included to describe the DCI symbols, Reference Signals and also 8 
DL-SCH data (if opted to allocated data for the remining symbols) as described in 38.141-1.  Play 9 
those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the 10 
entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate 11 
and decode the test frame. 12 
 13 
 14 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  15 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 16 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 17 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the PN23 sequence data in every other PRB 18 
in symbol #3 PRBs 5 to 23 if the test is conducted using option #1. 19 
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the PN23 sequence data in every PRB in 20 
symbol #3 PRBs 5 to 23 if the test is conducted using option #2. 21 
 22 
 23 
 UC Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using RB Parameter 3GPP UL – Resource 24 
Allocation 25 
A. Test Description and Applicability 26 
This test is MANDATORY. 27 
 28 
This test adds the capability of interpreting the rb parameter to the basic uplink test  29 
 30 
Validate correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition (Section 7.2 TS 31 
38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 138.104) and power Levels at least 32 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       86 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 Table 7.2.5-1.  This is to improve the 1 
likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing receiver 2 
sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance.  3 
 4 
 5 
 6  7 
Figure 3.2.3.1-5 SCS15k_25RB Uplink FDD Test Signal 8 
 9 
Using an RF data source, the test equipment will generate a 3GPP test signal as shown in Figure 3.2.3.1-5 10 
above.  The radio will demodulate and decode this signal and send frequency domain IQ to the O-DU-11 
Emulator as instructed by the O-DU-emulator using uplink C-Plane messages 12 
 13 
The TER (Test Equipment, O-RU) generates an uplink signal on the antenna connector or TAB connector, 14 
together with the corresponding C-Plane messages on the Fronthaul interface. 15 
 16 
The TER will capture the U-Plane messages generated by the DUT and validate if the payload matches with 17 
the uplink signal.  18 
 19 
It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 20 
 Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 21 
 Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 22 
 Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 23 
 24 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 25 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 26 
30 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP TS 38.141-1 section G-FR1-A-1.  27 
It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. The 28 
radio must report that it supports the rb parameter. Note this signal may be changed to any of the 3GPP sensitivity 29 
test signals in table A.1-1 in 3GPP TS 38.141-1 if the radio does not support the numerology and bandwidth used 30 
in this test.  The test signal described in this section will be used if the radio supports that numerology and 31 
bandwidth. 32 
 33 
C. Test Methodology 34 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       87 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
Leverage from the well-known payload (Pseudo Random sequence) of the uplink signal to compare it with the 1 
payload of the signal communicated on the O-RAN interface. The IQ information is extracted from the U-Plane 2 
message and demodulated to retrieve payload.  3 
  4 
a: Initial Conditions 5 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 6 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal source to the 7 
O-RU antenna port and configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon receiving a 8 
trigger signal from the CUSM-E.  The signal source power level should be adjusted to at least 30 dB 9 
above the setting used in the 3GPP receiver sensitivity test. 10 
b: Procedure 11 
 Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS30k_51RB) on the RF Signal Source.  Note this signal 12 
has a PN23 sequence as user data. 13 
 Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a 14 
trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 15 
 Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – In this test only symbol number 6 16 
will be used and all 51 PRBs will be used.   All other symbols will not contain data except required 17 
DRMS signals which may be used to synchronize test equipment. There are two options for 18 
conducting this test: 19 
A single data section with the rb bit set and a PN23 sequence sent as shown below: 20 
 21 
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB will contain only the odd parts of the 22 
PN23 sequence (as shown in blue).  The other PRBs (shown in orange) will not contain data and will 23 
not be sent to the O-RU.  Thus, a single data section will be used, and the corresponding U-Plane 24 
message will only contain data for the odd PRBs as shown above.  The parts of the PN23 sequence 25 
not used (shown marked with an X) will be discarded. 26 
2. Two data sections one containing the odd parts of the PN23 sequence and the other containing the 27 
even parts as shown below: 28 
 29 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       88 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1 
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB in one section will contain only the odd 2 
parts of the PN23 sequence (as shown in blue).  The second data section will contain the even parts of 3 
the PN23 sequence (as shown in orange).  The C-Plane messages for both sections will use the rb bit. 4 
The U-Plane messages corresponding to the first data section will contain only the odd parts of the 5 
PN23 sequence, the U-Plane message corresponding to the second data section will only contain the 6 
even parts.  Thus, a continuous PN23 sequence will be sent only in PRBs 0 through 51. 7 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  8 
 Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and trigger the source to play the RF signal on a 9 
frame boundary.  10 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 11 
Antenna port  12 
 Extract IQ information  13 
 Extract Payload 14 
 Compare payload binary sequences 15 
  16 
  17 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  18 
1. The   verdict is “Test pass” if payload binary sequences match between the uplink test frame sent to the DUT 19 
and the received U-Plane data from the DUT.  In particular symbol #6 should contain either every other PRB  20 
of the PN23 sequence or a continuous PN23 sequence in PRBs 0 through 51 depending which test option is 21 
chosen. 22 
2. If any of the test conditions is not true, the verdict for the whole test is "Fail". 23 
 24 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using SymInc Parameter 3GPP DL – 25 
Resource Allocation 26 
A. Test Description and Applicability 27 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 28 
 29 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       89 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 1 
the SymInc parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in 2 
the downlink.  This test is applicable for  Category A and  Category B radios (No precoding is required).  The test 3 
will be conducted therefore there will be no channel distortion or interference. 4 
 5 
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 6 
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 7 
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-6. 8 
 9 
 10  11 
Figure 3.2.3.1-6 NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 12 
 13 
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the remaining 14 
PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. 15 
 16 
This test requires to either populate all allocated resource blocks with non-zero data or leave all resource blocks, 17 
except for the resurce blocks under test, empty or unallocated.  In the case of nonzero data allocation, this data will 18 
be a PN23 sequence with a seed value of all ones. 19 
 20 
Two symbols will be reserved for testing the SymInc parameter as described below. 21 
 22 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 23 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 24 
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G 25 
New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. 26 
 27 
The Radio must support the SymInc parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The signal analyzer must have the 28 
ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 29 
 30 
C. Test Methodology 31 
a. Initial Conditions 32 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 33 
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 34 
antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 35 
demodulate the transmitted signal.   36 
b. Procedure 37 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  38 
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. If 39 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       90 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
all symbols have user data allocated, every symbol may be described by either multiple or a single type 1 1 
section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols #5 and #6 which will be used for the SymInc test. The data in 2 
these sections must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. Each symbol should be a new PN23 3 
sequence, that is PRB 0 should contain the data from a new PN23 sequence for each symbol. No section type 4 
zero messages will be used for this test. 5 
 6 
Symbols number 5 and 6 should be stock data sections type “E” as shown above.  This stock data section 7 
consists of two adjacent symbols each containing two sections.  The corresponding C-Plane message will 8 
contain 4 section IDs in a single C-Plane message describing symbols #5 and #6.  The startSymbolId in the 9 
application header will be symbol #5. The third section ID for symbol #6 will have the SymInc bit set 10 
informing the O-RU that the the third section will begin describing symbol #6.  11 
 12 
The corresponding U-Plane messages will be a new PN23 Sequence for each symbol (5 and 6). 13 
 14 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  15 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 16 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 17 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the same PN23 signals that were sent in the 18 
U-Plane. 19 
 20 
 UC Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using SymInc Parameter 3GPP UL – 21 
Resource Allocation 22 
A. Test Description and Applicability 23 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 24 
 25 
The purpose of this test is to add the capability of interpreting the SymInc parameter to the basic uplink test. 26 
 27 
Validate correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition (Section 7.2 TS 28 
38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 38.141) and power Levels at least 29 
30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 table 7.2.5-1.  This is to improve the 30 
likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing receiver 31 
sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance. C-Plane messages will contain 4 sections with the SymInc bit 32 
set specifying that the radio should increment the current symbol. 33 
 34 
 35  36

Figure 3.2.3.1-7 G-FR1-A5-1 Uplink FDD Test Signal 1 
 2 
Using an RF source, the test equipment will generate a 3GPP test signal as shown in Figure 3.2.3.1-7  above.  The 3 
radio will demodulate and decode this signal and send frequency domain IQ to the O-DU-Emulator as instructed by 4 
the O-DU-emulator using uplink C-Plane messages.  Note this signal has 20 slots with all symbols populated with 5 
only uplink shared data in the only first 51 RBs.  For this test, all the symbols except the ones being under test, 6 
symbols #5 and #6, may either be left empty/unallocated or be allocated with user data according to the test model 7 
above. If the symbols are populated with user data, PN23 data sequence will be used. 8 
 9 
The TER (Test Equipment, O-RU) generates an uplink signal on the antenna connector or TAB connector, together 10 
with the corresponding C-Plane messages on the Fronthaul interface. 11 
 12 
The TER will capture the U-Plane messages generated by the DUT and validate if the payload matches with the 13 
uplink signal.  14 
 15 
It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 16 
 Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 17 
 Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 18 
 Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 19

B. Test Entrance Criteria 21 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 22 
30 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP TS 38.141-1 section G-FR1-A1-23 
5.  It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. The 24 
radio must report that it supports the SymInc parameter.   Note this signal may be changed to any of the 3GPP 25 
sensitivity test signals in table A.1-1 in 3GPP TS 38.141-1 if the radio does not support the numerology and 26 
bandwidth used in this test.  The test signal described in this section will be used if the radio supports that 27 
numerology and bandwidth. 28 
 29 
C. Test Methodology 30 
Leverage from the well-known payload (Pseudo Random sequence) of the uplink signal to compare it with the 31 
payload of the signal communicated on the O-RAN interface. The IQ information is extracted from the U-Plane 32 
message and demodulated to retrieve payload.  33 
  34 
a. Initial Conditions 35 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 36 
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU 37 
antenna port and configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon receiving a trigger signal 38 
from the CUSM-E.  The signal source power level should be adjusted to at least 30 dB above the setting used 39 
in the 3GPP receiver sensitivity test. 40 
b. Procedure 41 
 Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS30k_51RB, 100 MHz) on the RF Signal Source.  Note this 42 
signal has a PN23 sequence as user data.  Configure the source to generate a new PN23 sequence in 43 
symbols #5 and #6. 44 
 Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a 45 
trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 46 
 Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – Only symbols #5 and #6 in each slot 47 
will be used in this test. All other symbols will contain either either user data and/or reference signalsbut 48 
will not be considered part of the test.  These two symbols will be used to determine whether the radio 49 
properly increments the current symbol ID when the SymInc bit is set. The C-Plane message for symbol 50 
#5 should have the SymInc bit set.  This message should have a third section describing symbol #6 (using 51 
the SymInc mechanism).  All PRBs in each symbol will be requested (In the example waveform 51 PRBs). 52 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  53 
 Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and trigger the source to play the RF signal on a frame 54 
boundary.  55 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna 56 
port  57 
 Extract IQ information  58

Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       92 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 Extract Payload 1 
 Compare payload binary sequences  2 
  3 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  4 
1. The verdict is “Test pass” if payload binary sequences match between the uplink test frame sent to the DUT 5 
and the received U-Plane data from the DUT.  In particular symbols number 5 and 6 should properly contain 6 
the correct PN23 sequences that were built by the signal source. 7 
2. If any of the test conditions is not true, the verdict for the whole test is "Fail" 8

 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using reMask Parameter 3GPP DL – 10 
Resource Allocation 11 
1. Test Description and Applicability 12 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 13 
 14 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can correctly decode and interpret C-Plane and U-Plane 15 
messages putting resource block in the correct place in the transmitted signal using the reMask parameter. In 16 
this test stock data section ”D” will be used to exercise the reMask, only PRBs 1 through 5 will be used in 17 
this test. 18 
 19 
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of 20 
the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to 21 
transmit on the downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal as modified below.  This signal is shown 22 
below in Figure 3.2.3.1-8: 23 
 24 
 25  26 
Figure 3.2.3.1-8 NR-FR1-TM1.1 Modification 1 27 
 28 
This generic 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot 29 
consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the remaining PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel 30 
data. 31 
 32 
Resource blocks that are not under test may be filled with non-zero data or may be left unallocated.  If filled 33 
with non-zero data, a PN23 sequence with a seed value of all ones must be used. 34 
 35 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages 36 
with the reMask parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource elements and transmit this 37 
data accurately in the downlink.  This test is applicable for  Category A and  Category B radios (No 38 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       93

precoding is required).  The test will be conducted therefore there will be no channel distortion or 1 
interference.  It is mandatory the radio pass this test to be considered O-RAN conformant. 2 
 3 
This test will utilize stock data section D described above. 4 
 5 
2. Test Entrance Criteria 6 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology 7 
will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-TM1.1.  It will 8 
be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. 9 
 10 
The Radio must support the reMask parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The signal analyzer must have 11 
the ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 12 
 13 
3. Test Methodology 14 
 15 
a. Initial Conditions 16 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 17 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to 18 
the O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to 19 
synch and demodulate the transmitted signal.   20 
b. Procedure 21 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU 22 
emulator.  Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that 23 
describe the signal as described below. If all symbols have user data allocated, every symbol may be 24 
described by type 1 sections (DL-SCH and DCI).   Only symbol #2 will be used for the reMask test. 25 
The data in this section must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. The first bits of the 26 
PN23 will be in PRB1 and continue in consecutive resource elements to the end of PRB5. No section 27 
type zero messages will be used for this test.  The PN23 sequence will be interleaved with DMRS 28 
signals as shown below: 29 
 30 
 31  32 
Symbol number 2 should be stock data section type “D” as shown above.  This test will only be using 33 
PRBs 1 through 5.  The corresponding C-Plane message will contain two section IDs in a single C-34 
Plane message describing symbol #2.  The startSymbolId in the application header will be symbol #2. 35 
The C-Plane message will have one section with the reMask set to all 101010101010b (only DMRS 36 
REs) and another section with the reMask set to all ones.  The first section (reMask = 101010101010b) 37 
will be for PRB 1 only, the second section will be for PRBs 2-5 and will have an reMask value of all 38 
ones.  The two sections will have different section IDs.  The remainder of the PRBs will not be used 39 
and set to zero value. 40 
The corresponding U-Plane messages will be a new PN23 Sequence (initial seed is all ones) in PRBs 1 41 
through 5 of symbol #2 alternated with the DMRS signals.  The first U-Plane message will correspond 42 
to sectionID with reMask set to 101010101010b and will contain one PRB with user data and DMRS 43 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       94 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
signals as shown.  The second U-Plane message will correspond to PRBs 2-5 and contain the same 1 
alternate data. The purpose of the section ID containing valid data is to ensure the radio sends a signal 2 
to synchronize the signal analyzer. 3 
 4 
4. Test Requirement (expected result)  5 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 6 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 7 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the same PN23 signals that were sent in 8 
the U-Plane only for PRBs 2-5.  Only DMRS signals should be sent for PRB1. 9

  UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using Non-contiguous PRB Allocation 22 
Section Extension 3GPP DL – Resource Allocation 23 
A. Test Description and Applicability 24 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 25 
 26 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can correctly decode and interpret C-Plane and U-Plane messages 27 
putting resource block in the correct place in the transmitted signal using the extension type 6. In this test stock data 28 
section definition C will be used to exercise the non-contiguous RB allocation, all 273 PRBs (or the max number of 29 
PRBs per symbol for the highest numerology the radio supports) will be used in this test. 30 
 31 
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 32 
described in section2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 33 
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal with the modifications described below (supporting non-contiguous 34 
PRB allocation)..  The standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 is shown in Figure 3.2.3.1-10 below: 35 
 36  37 
Figure 3.2.3.1-10 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 Test Signal 38 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       97 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
This generic NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 1 
3 PRBs.  All the remaining PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. 2 
 3 
This test might either populate all symbols with non-zero data or leave them unallocated/empty. If symbols are 4 
populated, a PN23 data sequence with seed all ones will be used. 5 
 6 
This test will utilize stock data section definition C described above.  This data section includes 4 RBs in the first 7 
RB group, the second group of 4 RBs are blank and the remainder of the RBGs contain user data.  This stock 8 
data section will be repeated over three symbols to test the SymbolMask parameter. 9 
 10 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 11 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1  of this document.  The test numerology will 12 
be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 13 
5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  The Radio must 14 
support the extension type 6 as notified by the M-Plane.  The signal analyzer must have the ability to decode the 15 
downlink shared channel. 16 
 17 
C. Test Methodology 18 
a. Initial Conditions 19 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 20 
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 21 
antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 22 
demodulate the transmitted signal.   23 
b. Procedure 24 
For this test only symbols number 6 and 7 will be used in each slot.   Other symbols may be used in this test or be left 25 
unallocated (unused).  However other symbols containing reference signals may be used to ensure the O-RU can 26 
synchronize with the TER.   27 
  The starting PRB will be zero and number of PRBs will be chosen from one or more columns in Table 28 
3.2.3.1-2 below.  The resource block group size will be 16 based on 3GPP 38.214 Table 5.1.2.2.1-1 as shown 29 
in Table 3.2.3.1-1 below using configuration 2.   30 
 31 
Bandwidth Part Size Configuration 1 Configuration 2 
1 – 36 2 4 
37 – 72 4 8 
73 – 144 8 16 
145 – 275 16 16 
Table 3.2.3.1-1 32 
 33 
Using the calculations in the O-RAN fronthaul specification [2] section 5.4.7.6 for the test waveform 34 
described above, the ID of the last RBG will be 17, f(0) will be 16, f(n) will be 16 and f(lastRbgID) will be 1 35 
(17 total RBGs).  StartPrbc will be zero and numPrbc will be 273.  If the radio does not support this 36 
numerology the following table will apply.  The number of PRBs correspond to Table 3.2.3.1-2 Stock Data 37

 2 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  3 
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. 4 
Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols 5 
#6 and #7 which will be used for the section extension 6 test. The data in symbol #6 should be a new PN23 6 
sequence starting in the first PRB and continuing to PRB 273 (RBG number 17).  Symbol #7 should be identical 7 
to symbol #6.  The rbgMask value should be set to 0000000000111111111111111101b and the symbolMask 8 
value should be set to 00000011000000b.  No section type zero messages will be used for this test. 9 
 10 
The O-DU emulator will build a U-Plane message containing the PN23 IQ data for the first 16 PRBs (RBG 0), 11 
this message will have the section ID used in the C-Plane message described above.  Another U-Plane message 12 
will be created using the same section ID but with the PN23 data for RBGs 2-17 in it.  The same U-Plane 13 
messages will be used for symbol #7. 14 
 15 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  16 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for this 17 
radio category (i.e., EVM). 18 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the same PN23 signals that were sent in the 19 
U-Plane, that is the PN23 sequence in the first 16 PRBs, nothing in the next 16 PRBs and the remainder of the 20 
PN23 sequence in RBGs 2-17. 21 
 22 
  UC Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using Non-contiguous PRB Allocation 23 
Section Extension 3GPP UL – Resource Allocation 24 
A. Test Description and Applicability 25 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 26 
 27 
The purpose of this test is to validate the capability of interpreting the section extension 6, non-contiguous PRB 28 
allocation to the basic uplink test. 29 
 30 
Validate correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition (Section 7.2 TS 31 
38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 38.141) and power Levels at least 32 
30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 table 7.2.5-1.  This is to improve the 33 
likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing receiver 34 
sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance. C-Plane messages will contain 2 symbols with the same set of 35 
non-contiguous PRBs referenced to test both the symbolMask and the rbgMask. 36 
 37 
 38 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       99 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1  2 
Figure 3.2.3.1-11 G-FR1-A5-1 UL FDD Test Signal 3 
 4 
Using an RF source, the test equipment will generate a 3GPP test signal as shown in Figure 3.2.3.1-11 above.  5 
The radio will demodulate and decode this signal and send frequency domain IQ to the O-DU-Emulator as 6 
instructed by the O-DU-emulator using uplink C-Plane messages containing section extension 6.  Note this 7 
signal has 20 slots with all symbols populated with only uplink shared data in the only first 51 RBs.  The 8 
symbols are populated with PN23 data. 9 
 10 
The TER (Test Equipment, O-RU) generates an uplink signal on the antenna connector or TAB connector, 11 
together with the corresponding C-Plane messages on the Fronthaul interface. 12 
 13 
The TER will capture the U-Plane messages generated by the DUT and validate if the payload matches with the 14 
uplink signal.  15 
 16 
It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 17 
 Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 18 
 Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 19 
 Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 20 
 21 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 22 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 23 
30 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP TS 38.141-1 section G-FR1-A1-5.  24 
It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. The 25 
radio must report that it supports section extension type 6, non-contiguous PRB allocations.  The radio must report 26 
that it supports section extension type 6, non-contiguous PRB allocations. Note this signal may be changed to any of 27 
the 3GPP sensitivity test signals in table A.1-1 in 3GPP TS 38.141-1 if the radio does not support the numerology 28 
and bandwidth used in this test.  The test signal described in this section will be used if the radio supports that 29 
numerology and bandwidth. 30 
 31 
C. Test Methodology 32 
Leverage from the well-known payload (Pseudo Random sequence) of the uplink signal to compare it with the 33 
payload of the signal communicated on the O-RAN interface. The IQ information is extracted from the U-Plane 34 
message and demodulated to retrieve payload.  35 
  36 
a. Initial Conditions 37 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       100 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using M-1 
Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna 2 
port and configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon receiving a trigger signal from the 3 
CUSM-E.  The signal source power level should be adjusted to at least 30 dB above the setting used in the 3GPP 4 
receiver sensitivity test. 5 
 6 
b. Procedure 7 
 Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS130k_51RB) on the RF Signal Source.  Note this signal 8 
should contain a new PN23 sequence as user data in PRBs 0 through 51 for symbols 6 and 7.  The remainder 9 
of the test waveform may be left unallocated or allocated as described in 3GPP. 10 
 Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a trigger 11 
signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 12 
 Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – Use the O-DU emulator control 13 
interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. For this test symbols number 6 14 
and 7 will be used in each slot.  The starting PRB will be zero and number of PRBs will be 273.  The 15 
resource block group size will be 16.  Using the calculations in the O-RAN fronthaul specification section 16 
5.4.7.6 the ID of the last RBG will be 17, f(0) will be 16, f(n) will be 16 and f(lastRbgID) will be 1.  17 
StartPrbc will be zero and numPrbc will be 273. 18 
If symbols other than #6 and #7 are allocated, every symbol should be described by multiple type 1 section 19 
(DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols #6 and #7 which will be used for the section extension 6 test. The data in 20 
symbol #6 is expected to be a new PN23 sequence starting in the first PRB and continuing to PRB 48 (RBG 21 
number 2).  Symbol #7 should be identical to symbol #6.  The rbgMask value should be set to 22 
0000000000000000000000000101b  and the symbolMask value should be set to 00000011000000b.  No 23 
section type zero messages will be used for this test. 24 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  25 
 Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and trigger the source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  26 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna port  27 
 Extract IQ information  28 
 Extract Payload 29 
 Compare payload binary sequences  30 
  31 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  32 
1. The verdict is “Test pass” if the test frame received by the signal analyzer contains the same PN23 signals that 33 
were sent in the U-Plane, that is the PN23 sequence in the first 16 PRBs, nothing in the next 16 PRBs and the 34 
remainder of the PN23 sequence in RBGs 2 (Next 16 PRBs). 35 
2. If any of the test conditions is not true, the verdict for the whole test is "Fail". 36 
 37 
 38 
 39 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Section Extension 10 – Multiple Port Grouping DL – 40 
Resource allocation 41 
A. Test Description and Applicability 42 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 43 
 44 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages when 45 
section extension 10 is supported by the radio, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit 46 
this data accurately in the downlink.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is 47 
required).  The test will be conducted therefore there will be no channel distortion or interference.  Note the 48 
purpose of this test is not to test the use of section extension 10 with either section extension 1 or 2 (Real time 49 
beam weights or attributes) since these are special conditions.  There are three versions of beam groupings: 50 
Common Beam, beam matrix indication or beam vector listing.  Each of these will be tested.  The beamforming 51 
measurements will be conducted using the method described in section 3.2.3.2.3 and 3.2.3.2.4 (Predefined 52 
beamforming). 53 
 54 
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 55 
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 56 
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-12. 57 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       101 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1  2 
 3 Figure 3.2.3.1-12 NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 4 
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the remaining 5 
PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. This test requires non-zero data (PN23 6 
Sequence)  to populate all allocated resource blocks.  This configuration corresponds to stock data section A in all 7 
symbols that do not contain PDCCH channels. 8 
 9 
For this test the O-RU will indicate the default eAxC ID to use indicating this port grouping as well as the number 10 
of ports in this grouping, call this value nPG. 11 
 12 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 13 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-14 
TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New Radio only.  15 
 16 
There will be numPortc “layers” or eAxCs referred to in the test.  That is there will be one C-Plane message 17 
referencing the port group eAxC ID obtained from the M-Plane but numPortc U-Plane messages. 18 
 19 
Manufacturers’ must provide their defined list of beam indices and their associated magnitude and phase relation 20 
between antenna ports or TAB connectors and/or beam directions with antenna array characteristics. 21 
 22 
 23 
C. Test Methodology 24 
 25 
a. Initial Conditions 26 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using M-27 
Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 28 
antenna ports being tested and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch 29 
and demodulate the transmitted signal.  Ensure that the RF connections and cables are calibrated so there is 30 
phase coherence between the antenna ports (or TAB connectors) within acceptable tolerance.  Let the DUT and 31 
TER to warm to the normal operating temperature within specified range. 32 
b. Procedure 33 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  34 
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane message that describes the signal.  35 


 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       102 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
This message should include section extension 10. Note the test will be performed three times exercising all 1 
three beam group types. Every symbol should be described by a single section (DL-SCH and DCI) using 2 
section type 1 messages. The data in the sections must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. No 3 
section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for each 4 
layer (i.e., numPortc repetitions).  5 
 6 
Test case #1 (beamGroupType = 00b, Common Beam): 7 
For this test the beamGroupType parameter should be set to 00b. It is expected that all layers will be played on 8 
the same beam ID and this is the beam ID used in the corresponding C-Plane message. Play those messages to 9 
the O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of 10 
times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  Use the 11 
signal analyzer to decode at least two beams and ensure they are the same. 12 
 13 
Test case #2 (beamGroupType = 01b, beam matrix indication): 14 
For this test the beamGroupType parameter should be set to 01b. It is expected that all layers will be played on 15 
consecutive beam IDs starting with the beam ID in the C-Plane message. Play those messages to the O-RU 16 
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times 17 
required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  Use the signal 18 
analyzer to decode at least two beams and ensure they meet the consecutive beam criteria. 19 
 20 
Test case #3 (beamGroupType = 10b, beam vector listing): 21 
For this test the beamGroupType parameter should be set to 10b. In this case the section extension should list 22 
“numPortc” beam IDs in section extension 10.  It is expected that all layers will be played on the beam IDs 23 
indicated in the section extension. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in 24 
section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow 25 
it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  Use the signal analyzer to decode at least two beams and ensure 26 
they agree with the beam vector listing. 27 
 28 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  29 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for this 30 
radio category (i.e., EVM). 31 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.   32 
3. If it contains all the same PRB assignments and data, and the beams are measured as described in test cases #1 33 
through #3 above the test passes. 34 
 35 
 UC Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended multiple port grouping using section 36 
extension 10 UL– Resource Allocation 37 
A. Test Description and Applicability 38 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 39 
 40 
The purpose of this test is to validate the capability of interpreting the section extension 10, multiple port groupings 41 
in the basic uplink test. 42 
 43 
Validate correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition (Section 7.2 TS 44 
38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 38.141) and power Levels at least 45 
30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 table 7.2.5-1.  This is to improve the 46 
likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing receiver 47 
sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance. Note the purpose of this test is not to test the use of section 48 
extension 10 with either section extension 1 or 2 (Real time beam weights or attributes) since these are special 49 
conditions.  There are three versions of beam groupings: Common Beam, beam matrix indication or beam vector 50 
listing.  Each of these will be tested.  The beamforming measurements will be conducted using the method 51 
described in section 3.2.3.2.3 and 3.2.3.2.4 (Predefined beamforming). 52 
 53 
Only section type 1 messages will be used in this test. 54 
. 55
