 TDD UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Compression Static Format (SF) Block Floating 31 
Point + Selective RE Format 32 
A. Test Description and Applicability 33 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY and shall be performed if the O-RU supports this compression format  34 
 35 
The Block Floating-Point+ Selective RE Format scenario is a static format scenario that will verify DL and UL 36 
correct encoding of IQ information for 2 supported bit widths: 9 bits or 14 bits. 37 
 38 
For this test scenario, the compression test methodology will be based on the description in section 3.2.5.3.1  39 
 40 
However, on top of the test frame requirements from section 3.2.5.3.1, this test scenario also requires a test frame 41 
that MUST include PRBs with a combination of allocated and empty Resource Elements in the same symbol, to 42 
verify if the O-RU properly interprets the sReMask value in the udCompParam field (user data compression 43 
parameter). The measurements must be performed on the symbols that include a combination of empty and 44 
allocated resource elements.  45 
 46 
The recommended test frame is based on Type 2 DMRS with 2 DMRS CDM groups without data. The resource 47 
mapping model for the Resource Blocks is shown on the diagram below, where both symbols #2 and #11 include a 48 
combination of empty and allocated Resources. 49 
 50 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       283 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1 
 2 Figure 3.2.5.3-3  Recommended Frame ST BFP + Selective RE 3 
 4 
 5 
The uncompressed and compressed test frames are listed in Table 3.2.5.3-9. 6 
 7 
Stimulus File Name Description 
NR-FR1-TDD -CMP-TST -ST-DL-UNC-RE-16B Static Downlink Uncompressed (CU-plane) with both 
empty and allocated RE in the same symbol   
NR-FR1-TDD -CMP-TST -ST-UL-UNC-RE-16B 
 
Static Uplink Uncompressed (C-plane only) with both 
empty and allocated RE in the same symbol   
 
NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-DL-BRE-9B Static Downlink Block Floating Point + Selective RE 9 
Bits (CU-plane)  
NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-DL-BRE-14B Static Downlink Block Floating Point + Selective 14 
Bits (CU-plane)  
NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-UL-BRE-9B 
Static Uplink Block Floating Point 9 Bits + Selective 
RE  
 (C-plane only)

RE (C-plane only)  
Table 3.2.5.3-9  Stimulus Files for ST BFP + Selective RE 8 
 9

B. Test Entrance Criteria 11 
Same as 3.2.3.3.2 for static Block floating point + Selective RE formats. 12 
 13 
C. Test Methodology 14 
 Same as 3.2.3.3.2 with Static Block Floating Point + Selective RE test patterns.  15 
 16 
The uncompressed test frames used for this test are 17 
 NR-FR1-TDD -CMP-TST -ST-DL-UNC-RE-16B 18 
 NR-FR1-TDD -CMP-TST -ST-UL-UNC-RE-16B 19 
 20 
The compressed test frames used for this test are  21 
 NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-DL-BRE-9B 22 
 NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-DL-BRE-14B 23 
 NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-UL-BRE-9B 24 
 NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-UL-BRE-14B 25

Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       284 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 TDD UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Compression Static Format (SF) mod-compr + 1 
Selective RE Format 2 
A. Test Description and Applicability 3 
This test is CONDITIONALMANDATORY and shall be performed if the O-RU supports this compression format. 4 
 5 
This modulation compression + Selective format scenario is a static format scenario, based on 3.2.3.3.2 with some 6 
important differences 7 
 The purpose is to validate Radio Unit’s correct interpretation of the Modulation compression parameters 8 
used in the Section Extension Type =4  9 
 The test will only verify Downlink correct encoding of IQ information, as the Modulation Compression 10 
model is not applicable for uplink 11 
 As the Modulation Compression model does not require IQ bit width to be setup, there is no need to run 12 
multiple compression tests for various IQ bit widths.  13 
 14 
On top of the test frame requirements described above , this test scenario requires a test frame that MUST include 15 
PRBs with a combination of allocated and empty Resource Elements in the same symbol, to verify if the O-RU 16 
properly interprets the sReMask value in the udCompParam field (user data compression parameter).. The 17 
measurements must be performed on the symbols that include a combination of empty and allocated resource 18 
elements.  19 
 20 
The recommended test frame is based on Type 2 DMRS with 2 DMRS CDM groups without data. The resource 21 
mapping model for the Resource Blocks is shown on the diagram below, where both symbols #2 and #11 include a 22 
combination of empty and allocated Resources. 23 
 24 
 25 Figure 3.2.5.3-4 Frame Format SF Mod-comp + Selective RE 26 
 27 
The uncompressed and compressed test frames are listed in the table below  28 
 29

empty and allocated RE in the same symbol   
TDD-NR-FR1-CMP-TST-FRAME-ST-DL-MRE Static Downlink Modulation Compression + Selective 
RE

 TDD UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Compression Non-Static Format (NS) Block 14 
Floating Point + Selective RE Format 15 
A. Test Description and Applicability 16 
This test is CONDITIONALMANDATORY and shall be performed if the O-RU supports this compression format. 17 
 18 
This Block Floating-Point+ Selective RE Format scenario is a non-static format scenario that will verify DL and 19 
UL correct encoding of IQ information for 2 supported bit widths: 9 bits or 14 bits. 20 
For this test scenario, the compression test methodology will be based on the description in section 3.2.3.3.1  21 
 22 
However, on top of the test frame requirements from section 3.2.3.3.1, this test scenario also requires a test frame 23 
that MUST include PRBs with a combination of allocated and empty Resource Elements in the same symbol, to 24 
verify if the O-RU properly interprets the sReMask value in the udCompParam field (user data compression 25 
parameter). The measurements must be performed on the symbols that include a combination of empty and 26 
allocated resource elements.  27 
 28 
A test frame example can be based on Type 2 DMRS with 2 DMRS CDM groups without data. The resource 29 
mapping model for the Resource Blocks is shown on the diagram below, where both symbols #2 and #11 include a 30 
combination of empty and allocated Resources. 31

3.2.6 FR1 and FR2 TDD Non-conducted OTA Signal Tests 1 
 2 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class NR testing Generic (NRG)  3 
All TDD tests described in this section will be combined UL and DL tests (i.e., a single test frame describing 4 
bothuplink anddownlink). The default test frame used in this section is described in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document 5 
for FR1 radios and Section 3.2.1.1.4 for FR2 radios.  6 
There are several variations on this test signal depending on the capabilities of the radio.  If the radio does not support 7 
the numerology used in the example tests as reported in the M-plane it will be up to the test developer to modify their 8 
tests to adapt to the radio.  This can usually be accomplished by using stock test patterns described above.  The test is 9 
expected to follow the same spirit as the tests in this document but things like symbol numbers, number of PRBs, etc. 10 
may have to be changed. 11 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Base 3GPP DL/UL 12 
A. Test Description and Applicability 13 
This test is MANDATORY. 14 
 15 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the most basic uplink and downlink requirements for O-16 
RAN fronthaul using a TDD signal.  Subsequent tests will build on this to exercise additional capabilities of the 17 
Fronthaul. 18 
 19 
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4 for FR2, the O-DU emulator 20 
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 21 
require the O-RU to transmit on the downlink and uplink the default signal.   22 
 23 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit and receive  a basic 3GPP, TDD test frame using the 24 
default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.5 of this document (or a similar 3GPP waveform) except only one spatial 25 
stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is 26 
required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data will also be a PN23 27 
sequence. 28 
 29 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 30 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4 for FR2 of this document.  31 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-32 
TM1.1 for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for 33 
FR2.  It will be for 5G New Radio only.  34 
 35 
 36 
C. Test Methodology 37 
a. Initial Conditions 38 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 39 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer and 40 
signal source to the O-RU antenna ports and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to 41 
allow it to synch and demodulate the transmitted signal.   42 
b. Procedure 43 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 44 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator.  Built the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal 45 
source. Use the CUSM emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe 46 
the signal. Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for 47 
the test, DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for 48 
this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the 49 
O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the 50 
entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and 51 
decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate 52 
downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving 53 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       289 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the 1 
signal source. 2 
 3 
 4 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  5 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 6 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 7 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer shall be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains all 8 
the same PRB assignments and  the PN23 sequence, the test passes. 9 
 10 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation 11 
A. Test Description and Applicability 12 
This test is MANDATORY. 13 
 14 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the extended uplink and downlink requirements for O-RAN 15 
fronthaul using a TDD signal.  This test modifies the previous test by using a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH 16 
sections. 17 
 18 
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O-DU emulator 19 
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 20 
require the O-RU to transmit on thedownlink and uplink the default signal.   21 
 22 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit and receive  an extended 3GPP TDD test frame using 23 
the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document (or a similar 3GPP 24 
waveform) except only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and 25 
Category B radios (No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all 26 
uplink user data will also be a PN23 sequence. 27 
 28 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 29 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  30 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-31 
TM1.1 for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for 32 
FR2.  It will be for 5G New Radio only.  33 
 34 
 35 
C. Test Methodology 36 
a. Initial Conditions 37 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 38 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 39 
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 40 
demodulate the transmitted signal.   41 
b. Procedure 42 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 43 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 44 
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 45 
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 46 
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, 47 
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  48 
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 49 
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire 50 
frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the 51 
test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 52 
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane 53 
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source. 54 
 55 
 56 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       290 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  1 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 2 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 3 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer shall be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains all 4 
the same PRB assignments and the PN23 sequence, the test passes. 5 
 6 
 7 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using SymInc parameter 3GPP DL/UL – 8 
Resource Allocation 9 
A. Test Description and Applicability 10 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 11 
 12 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 13 
the SymInc parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in 14 
the downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with the SymInc parameter set.    15 
This test uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 16 
 17 
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O-DU emulator 18 
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 19 
require the O-RU to transmit on thedownlink and uplink the specified signal using the SymInc bit in both uplink 20 
and downlink.   21 
 22 
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 23 
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 24 
will also be a PN23 sequence. 25 
 26 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 27 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  28 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1   29 
for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for FR2.  It will 30 
be for 5G New Radio only.  31 
 32 
The radio must support the SymInc Parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the 33 
ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 34 
 35 
 36 
C. Test Methodology 37 
a. Initial Conditions 38 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 39 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 40 
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 41 
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna port and configure it as 42 
described below. 43 
b. Procedure 44 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 45 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 46 
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 47 
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 48 
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, 49 
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  50 
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 51 
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire 52 
frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the 53 
test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 54 
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane 55 
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source. 56 
 57 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       291 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1 
For the downlink slots and symbols: Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-2 
SCH and DCI) except symbols #5 and #6 which will be used for the SymInc test. The data in these sections 3 
must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. Each symbol should be a new PN23 sequence, 4 
that is PRB 0 should contain the data from a new PN23 sequence for each symbol. Symbols number 5 and 5 
6 should be stock data sections type “E” as shown above.  This stock data section consists of two adjacent 6 
symbols each containing two sections.  The corresponding C-Plane message will contain 4 section IDs in a 7 
single C-Plane message describing symbols #5 and #6.  The startSymbolId in the application header will be 8 
symbol #5. The second section ID for symbol #5 will have the SymInc bit set informing the O-RU that the 9 
next section will begin describing symbol #6. The corresponding U-Plane messages will be a new PN23 10 
sequence for each symbol (5 and 6). Symbol #6 contains PTRS in TM FR2-TM1.1. The data payload 11 
should be mapped around the PTRS.  Additional sections should be included to describe the DCI symbols 12 
as well as Reference Signals described in 38.141-1.  13 
 14 
For the uplink sections and symbols: Load uplink test waveform  on the RF Signal Source.  Note this 15 
signal has a PN23 sequence as user data.  Configure the source to generate a new PN23 sequence in 16 
symbols #5 and #6.  Configure the Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting 17 
when it receives a trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that all C-Plane messages have been sent.  Ensure 18 
the O-RU and source are synchronized so downlink slots do not conflict with uplink slots.  Load C-Plane 19 
message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – Only symbols #5 and #6 in each slot will be used in 20 
this test. All other symbols will contain either reference signals or data but will not be considered part of 21 
the test.  These two symbols will be used to determine whether the radio properly increments the current 22 
symbol ID when the SymInc bit is set. The C-Plane message for symbol #5 should have the SymInc bit set.  23 
This message should have a second section describing symbol #6 (using the SymInc mechanism).  All 24 
PRBs in each symbol will be requested (In the example waveform 51 PRBs). 25 
 26 
Steps: 27 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  28 
 Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 29 
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  30 
 Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 31 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal 32 
analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the frame. 33 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 34 
Antenna port  35 
 Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 36 
 Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 37 
 Extract Payload for both signals 38 
 Compare payload binary sequences  39 
 40 
 41 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  42 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 43 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 44 
2. The signal extracted by the U-Plane messages (uplink) should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 45 
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 46 
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it 47 
contains all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 data, the downlink test passes. 48 
4. The test frame extracted from the uplink U-Plane messages should be the same as the uplink signal 49 
described above.  If it contains all the same PRB assignments and correct PN23 data, the uplink test passes. 50 
 51 
 52

 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using reMask parameter 3GPP DL/UL – 1 
Resource Allocation 2 
A. Test Description and Applicability 3 
This test is MANDATORY. 4 
 5 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 6 
the reMask parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in 7 
the downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with the reMask parameter set.    8 
This test uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 9 
 10 
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O-DU emulator 11 
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 12 
require the O-RU to transmit on thedownlink and uplink the specified signal using the rb bit in both uplink and 13 
downlink.   14 
 15 
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 16 
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 17 
will also be a PN23 sequence. 18 
 19 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 20 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  21 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1   22 
for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for FR2.  It will 23 
be for 5G New Radio only.  24 
 25 
The radio must support the reMask Parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the 26 
ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 27 
 28 
C. Test Methodology 29 
a. Initial Conditions 30 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 31 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 32 
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 33 
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna port and configure it as 34 
described below. 35 
b. Procedure 36 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 37 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 38 
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 39 
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 40 
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, 41 
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  42 
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 43 
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire 44 
frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the 45 
test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 46 
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane 47 
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source. 48 
 49 
For the downlink slots and symbols: Symbol number 2 should be stock data section type “D” as shown in 50 
Figure 3.2.3.1-4.  This test will only be using PRBs 1 through 5.  The corresponding C-Plane message will 51 
contain a section IDs in a single C-Plane message describing symbol #6.  The startSymbolId in the 52 
application header will be symbol #6. The C-Plane message will have one section with the reMask set to 53 
only the odd number resource elements.  The number of PRBs will be 5. The start PRB will be 1. 54 
 55 
The corresponding U-Plane message will be a new PN23 Sequence (initial seed is all ones) in PRBs 1 56 
through 5 of symbol #2. 57 
 58 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       293 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
For the uplink sections and symbols: Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) 1 
symbol #5 in each slot will be used to determine whether the radio properly transmits only every other 2 
resource element when the reMask is set. No other symbols will be used in this test, however other symbols 3 
containing reference signals should be used to ensure the O-RU can synchronize with the TER.  The TER 4 
will not request any other symbols from the O-RU in this test.  The C-Plane message for symbol #5 should 5 
have the reMask set to tell the radio to send only every odd resource element. Only the PRBs 1 through 5 6 
will be used in this section (matching stock data section type “D”). The number of PRBs will be 4 and the 7 
start PRB will be 1. 8 
 9 
Steps: 10 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  11 
 Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 12 
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  13 
 Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 14 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal 15 
analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the frame. 16 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 17 
Antenna port  18 
 Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 19 
 Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 20 
 Extract Payload for both signals 21 
 Compare payload binary sequences  22 
 23 
 24 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  25 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 26 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 27 
2. The signal extracted by the U-Plane messages (uplink) should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 28 
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 29 
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it 30 
contains all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 sequence as data, the downlink test passes. 31 
4. The test frame extracted from the uplink U-Plane messages should be the same as the uplink signal 32 
described above.  If it contains all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 sequence as data, the 33 
uplink test passes. 34 
 35 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using RB parameter 3GPP DL/UL – 36 
Resource Allocation 37 
A. Test Description and Applicability 38 
This test is MANDATORY. 39 
 40 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 41 
the rb parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the 42 
downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with the rb parameter set.    This test 43 
uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 44 
 45 
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O-DU emulator 46 
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 47 
require the O-RU to transmit on thedownlink and uplink the specified signal using the rb bit in both uplink and 48 
downlink.   49 
 50 
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 51 
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 52 
will also be a PN23 sequence. 53 
 54 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 55 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  56 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-57 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       294 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
TM1.1 for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for 1 
FR2.  It will be for 5G New Radio only.  2 
 3 
C. Test Methodology 4 
a. Initial Conditions 5 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 6 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 7 
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 8 
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna port and configure it as 9 
described below. 10 
b. Procedure 11 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 12 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 13 
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 14 
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 15 
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, 16 
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  17 
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 18 
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire 19 
frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the 20 
test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 21 
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane 22 
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source. 23 
 24 
For the downlink slots and symbols: Every allocated (see below) symbol should be described by a single 25 
section (DL-SCH and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for 26 
this test.  Symbol #3 of each downlink slot should be Stock data section type  “D” as shown in section 27 
3.2.1.1.5 above. The control plane message for symbol #3 will only include PRBs number 5 through 23.  28 
This C-Plane message will have the rb bit set to one for this section. All other DL-SCH symbols will not 29 
contain data except required reference signals needed to synchronize the signal analyzer.  Encapsulate the 30 
IQ data in U-Plane messages. U-Plane data in symbol #3 will include a new PN23 sequence starting with 31 
an initial seed of all ones starting in PRB number 5. Additional sections should be included to describe the 32 
DCI symbols as well as Reference Signals described in TS 38.141-1.  33 
 34 
For the uplink sections and symbols: Load uplink test waveform  on the RF Signal Source.  Note this 35 
signal has a PN23 sequence as user data.  Configure the Signal Source to play the  TDD test waveforms on 36 
10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that all C-Plane 37 
messages have been sent.  Ensure the O-RU and source are synchronized so downlink slots do not conflict 38 
with uplink slots. Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – This C-Plane 39 
sequence should describe a single section per uplink symbol (51 RBs per symbol).  The C-Plane message 40 
for uplink symbol #6 should have the rb bit set.  All other sections should have the rb bit set to zero.  41 
 42 
 43 
Steps: 44 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  45 
 Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 46 
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  47 
 Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 48 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal 49 
analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the frame. 50 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 51 
Antenna port  52 
 Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 53 
 Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 54 
 Extract Payload for both signals 55 
 Compare payload binary sequences  56 
 57 
 58 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       295 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  1 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 2 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 3 
2. The signal extracted by the U-Plane messages (uplink) should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 4 
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 5 
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 6 
all the same PRB assignments and PN23 sequence data, the downlink test passes. 7 
4. The test frame extracted from the uplink U-Plane messages shall be the same as the uplink signal described 8 
above.  If it contains all the same PRB assignments and PN23 sequence data, the uplink test passes. 9 
 10 
 11 
 12 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using Non-contiguous PRB Allocation 13 
Section Extension 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation 14 
 15 
A. Test Description and Applicability 16 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 17 
 18 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 19 
section extension 6, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the 20 
downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with section extension 6.    This test 21 
uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 22 
 23 
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O-DU emulator 24 
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 25 
require the O-RU to transmit on thedownlink and uplink the specified signal using section extension 6 in both 26 
uplink and downlink.   27 
 28 
In this test stock data section definition C will be used to exercise the non-contiguous RB allocation, all 273 PRBs 29 
(51 in the uplink slots) or the max number of PRBs per symbol for the highest numerology the radio supports will 30 
be used in this test. 31 
 32 
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 33 
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 34 
will also be a PN23 sequence. 35 
 36 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 37 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  38 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1  39 
for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for FR2.  It will 40 
be for 5G New Radio only.  41 
 42 
The radio must support section extension 6 as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the ability 43 
to decode the downlink shared channel. 44 
 45 
C. Test Methodology 46 
a. Initial Conditions 47 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 48 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 49 
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 50 
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna port and configure it as 51 
described below. 52 
b. Procedure 53 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 54 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 55 
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 56 
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 57 
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, 58

DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  1 
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 2 
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times 3 
required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the 4 
responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD 5 
transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, 6 
extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source. 7 
 8 
 9 
For the downlink slots and symbols: Only symbols number 6 and 7 will be used in each slot. Symbol #6 10 
contains PTRS in TM FR2-TM1.1. The data payload should be mapped around the PTRS.  Other symbols 11 
may contain data including reference signals to ensure test equipment can synchronize with the signal.  The 12 
starting PRB will be zero and number of PRBs will be chosen from one or more columns in Table 3.2.6.1-2 13 
below.  The resource block group size will be 16 based on 3GPP 38.214 Table 5.1.2.2.1-1 as shown in 14 
Table 3.2.6.1-1 below using configuration 2.   15

 18 
Using the calculations in the O-RAN fronthaul specification [2] section 5.4.7.6 for the FR1 test waveform 19 
described above, the ID of the last RBG will be 17, f(0) will be 16, f(n) will be 16 and f(lastRbgID) will be 20 
1 (17 total RBGs), startPrbc will be zero and numPrbc will be 273.  For the FR2 test waveform, the ID of 21 
the last RBG will be 8, f(0) will be 8, f(n) will be 8 and f(lastRbgID) will be 2 (8 total RBGs), startPrbc 22 
will be zero and numPrbc will be 66.  If the radio does not support this numerology the following table will 23 
apply.  The number of PRBs correspond to Table 3.2.3.1-2 Stock Data Sections: 24

 28 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal for FR1 or NR-FR2-TM1.1 for FR2 as 29 
described above in the O-DU emulator.  Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-30 
Plane messages that describe the signal. Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH 31

Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       297 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
and DCI) except symbols #6 and #7 which will be used for the section extension 6 test. The data in symbol #6 1 
should be a new PN23 sequence starting in the first PRB and continuing to PRB 273 (RBG number 17) for 2 
FR1 and PRB 66 (RBG number 8) for FR2.  Symbol #7 should be identical to symbol #6.  The rbgMask value 3 
should be set to 0x3FFFD for FR1 or 0x1FD for FR2, and the symbolMask value should be set to 4 
00000011000000b.  No section type zero messages will be used for this test. 5 
 6 
 7 
The O-DU emulator will build a U-Plane message containing the PN23 IQ data for the first 16 PRBs (RBG 0), 8 
this message will have the section ID used in the C-Plane message described above.  Another U-Plane message 9 
will be created using the same section ID but with the PN23 data for the rest of the RBGs except for RBG 1 in 10 
it.  The same U-Plane messages will be used for symbol #7. 11 
 12 
For the uplink sections and symbols: For this test symbols number 6 and 7 will be used in each slot.  For the 13 
FR1 waveform, the starting PRB will be zero and number of PRBs will be 51.  The resource block group size 14 
will be 8.  Using the calculations in the O-RAN fronthaul specification section 5.4.7.6 the ID of the last RBG 15 
will be 6, f(0) will be 8, f(n) will be 8 and f(lastRbgID) will be 3.  For the FR2 waveform the parameters are 16 
similar to the downlink indicated above.   17 
 18 
Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols #6 and #7 19 
which will be used for the section extension 6 test. The data in symbol #6 is expected to be a new PN23 20 
sequence starting in the first PRB and continuing to PRB 51 (RBG number 6) for FR1 or PRB 66 (RBG number 21 
8 for FR2).  Symbol #7 should be identical to symbol #6.  The rbgMask value should be set to 0x7D for FR1 and 22 
0x1FD for FR2,  and the symbolMask value should be set to 00000011000000b.  No section type zero messages 23 
will be used for this test.  If the radio only supports another numerology see the tables above in the downlink 24 
sections and symbols for appropriate modifications. 25 
 26 
Steps: 27 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  28 
 Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 29 
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  30 
 Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 31 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal 32 
analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the frame. 33 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 34 
Antenna port  35 
 Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 36 
 Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 37 
 Extract Payload for both signals 38 
 Compare payload binary sequences  39 
 40 
 41 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  42 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 43 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 44 
2. The signal extracted by the U-Plane messages (uplink) should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 45 
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 46 
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it 47 
contains all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 sequence as data, the downlink test passes. 48 
4. The test frame extracted from the uplink U-Plane messages should be the same as the uplink signal 49 
described above.  If it contains all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 sequence as data, the 50 
uplink test passes. 51

 UC- Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation – 1 
Coupling C and U plane via time and frequency 2 
A. Test Description and Applicability 3 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 4 
 5 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the extended uplink and downlink requirements for O-RAN 6 
fronthaul using a TDD signal.  This test uses time and frequency to couple C-Plane and U-Plane messages. 7 
 8 
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O-DU emulator 9 
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 10 
require the O-RU to transmit on thedownlink and uplink the default signal.   11 
 12 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit and receive  an extended 3GPP TDD test frame using 13 
the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document (or a similar 3GPP waveform) except only one spatial 14 
stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding 15 
is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data will also be a 16 
PN23 sequence. The radio must report over the M-Plane that it supports C and U plane coupling via time and 17 
frequency. 18 
 19 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 20 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  21 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-22 
TM1.1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for FR2.  It will 23 
be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must report over the M-Plane that it supports C and U plane coupling via 24 
time and frequency. 25 
 26 
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer and signal 27 
source.  It must also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 28 
 29 
C. Test Methodology 30 
a. Initial Conditions 31 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 32 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 33 
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 34 
demodulate the transmitted signal.   35 
b. Procedure 36 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 in the CUSM 37 
emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared channel.  Build the appropriate test 38 
frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator control interface to build the appropriate 39 
C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. Every symbol used in the test should be 40 
described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 41 
messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane 42 
messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described 43 
in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and 44 
allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer 45 
and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is 46 
responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be 47 
compared to those sent by the signal source.  All section IDs in C-Plane messages and downlink U-Plane 48 
messages must be 4095. 49 
 50 
C-Plane and Downlink U-Plane messages sent by the TER will have valid values in the following fields: 51 
 EAxC ID 52 
 Datadirection bit  53 
 Frame ID, subframeID, slotID, startsymbolID, and NumSymbol 54 
 SectionID must have a value 4095 55 
 SymInc, rb reMask and section extension #6 are not used in this test 56 
 57 
It is the responsibility of the TER to properly arrange uplink U-Plane messages using only time and 58 
frequency resources. 59 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       299 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
 1 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  2 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 3 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 4 
2. All received U-Plane messages must have section ID equal to 4095 5 
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 6 
all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the test passes. 7 
 8 
 UC- Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL/UL – Coupling C and U plane via 9 
Time and Frequency and Section Description Priorities 10 
A. Test Description and Applicability 11 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 12 
 13 
The purpose of this test is to test whether the radio can implement coupling U and C plane via time and frequency 14 
and section description priorities requirements for O-RAN fronthaul using a TDD signal.  This test combines the 15 
FDD, uplink and downlink tests for these same features.  Note, there are two versions of this feature: coupling C 16 
and U plane messages via frequency and time and Section Description Priorities and coupling C and U plane 17 
messages via frequency and time and Section Description Priorities (optimized).  This test requires both tests to be 18 
performed if the radio supports both methods otherwise only one test is to be performed in the radio only supports 19 
one of these methods.  These methods are listed under test methodology below. 20 
 21 
Starting with the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O-DU 22 
emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages 23 
that require the O-RU to transmit on thedownlink and uplink the signals described below.   24 
 25 
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 26 
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 27 
will also be a PN23 sequence. 28 
 29 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 30 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document 31 
and those specified below.  The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as 32 
described by TM-FR1-TM1.1 for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by 33 
TM FR2-TM1.1 for FR2.  It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) 34 
or TAB connectors.  It will be a TDD signal. 35 
 36 
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer and signal 37 
source.  It must also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 38 
 39 
C. Test Methodology 40 
a. Initial Conditions 41 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 42 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 43 
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 44 
demodulate the transmitted signal.   45 
b. Procedure for Coupling C and U plane messages via frequency and time with section priorities 46 
Build an appropriate C and U plane signals for the signals described below in the CUSM emulator. Every 47 
slot used in the test should be described by a single C-Plane message with multiple sections (DL-SCH that 48 
are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using a section type 1 message. No section type zero messages will 49 
be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those 50 
messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame 51 
the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test 52 
frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 53 
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane 54 
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source. 55 
 56 
 Downlink procedure: 57 
 58

Table 3.2.6.1-3 Time and Frequency Coupling with Priority TDD DL 1 
 2 
 3 
In this test the section configuration will be as shown in Table 3.2.6.1-3 above.  The 6 sections will comprise 4 
one slot and this slot will be repeated continuously in the downlink slots in the TDD frame to synchronize the 5 
TER signal analyzer.  The six sections will be sent on one C-Plane message using C and U plane coupling 6 
via time and frequency.  The configuration above follows the example given in the CUSM specification. 7 
The section numbers in the above table do not represent SectionID numbers but individual sections. Sections 8 
#1 and #2 describe hypothetical DMRS signals sent in symbols #2 and #11 in each slot.  These signals have 9 
every other subcarrier masked by reMask. This is the same as shown above in the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 10 
test signal shown above for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2. The DMRS signals in symbol #2 have beam ID 1 and 11 
symbol #11 have beam ID 2.  These sections use section extension 6 and contain a higher priority than all 12 
other sections.  13 
Section #3 describes PN23 data sent to hypothetical UE #1 it overlaps REs in sections #1 and #2 but has a 14 
lower priority so sections #1 and #2 are valid.  Since section #3 has contiguous symbols section extension 6 15 
is not needed. 16 
Section #4 is for hypothetical UE #2. It occupies the same symbols as the DMRS signals but uses a different 17 
reMask.  Since the symbols are not contiguous it uses sections extension 6 but the priority is set to the default 18 
0. 19 
Section #5 is for hypothetical UE #3 and uses a contiguous set of symbols so section extension 6 is not 20 
needed.  It does not overlap any other signals.  This section is optional because it does not test Section 21 
Description Priority. 22 
Section #6 is a hypothetical special channel using only one symbol and does not require section extension 6.  23 
This section is also optional. 24 
U-Plane messages will contain: 25

 DMRS signals for every odd resource element as described by section #1 for symbol #11 1 
 DMRS signals for every odd resource element as described by section #2 for symbol #2 2 
 A new PN23 sequence in each of the first 5 symbols as described in section #3.  Note that for 3 
symbol #2 the PN sequence will be pierced by the DMRS signals. 4 
 A new PN23 sequence for symbol #6 as described by section #4 as well as a new PN sequence for 5 
symbol #11.  These sequences are only 32 PRBs long and start in PRB 15. The sequence in symbol 6 
#11 will be pierced by DMRS signals. 7 
 The user data for sections number #5 and #6 are standard PN23 sequences only for these symbols 8 
and PRBs described in the table above.  Symbol #6 contains PTRS in TM FR2-TM1.1. The data 9 
payload should be mapped around the PTRS. 10

In this test the section configuration will be as shown in Table 3.2.6.1-4 above.  The 6 sections will 20 
comprise one slot and this slot will be repeated to fill the entire frame (i.e., 20 times).  The six sections 21 
will be sent on one C-Plane message using C and U plane coupling via time and frequency.  The 22 
configuration above follows the example given in the CUSM specification. 23 
o The section numbers in the above table do not represent SectionID numbers but individual sections. 24 
Sections #1 and #2 describe hypothetical DMRS signals sent in symbols #2 and #11 in each slot.  25 
These signals have every other subcarrier masked by reMask. This is the same as shown above in 26 
the standard G-FR1-A1-5 test signal shown above with the exception that the DMRS signals 27 
continue for all 273 RBs. The DMRS signals in symbol #2 have beam ID 1 and symbol #11 have 28

beam ID 2.  These sections use section extension 6 and contain a higher priority than all other 1 
sections.  2 
o Section #3 describes PN23 data sent to hypothetical UE #1 it overlaps REs in sections #1 and #2 3 
but has a lower priority so sections #1 and #2 are valid.  Since section #3 has contiguous symbols 4 
section extension 6 is not needed.  Note it starts in PRM 64 (RBG 4) and continues for the 5 
remainder of the 273 RBs. 6 
o Section #4 is for hypothetical UE #2. It occupies the same symbols as the DMRS signals but uses a 7 
different reMask.  Since the symbols are not contiguous it uses sections extension 6 but the priority 8 
is set to the default 0.  It also starts in RBG 4 (RB 64) and continues to the rest of the 273 RBs. 9

not needed.  It does not overlap any other signals.  This section is optional because it does not test 11 
Section Description Priority. 12

extension 6.  This section is also optional. 14 
 Load the following waveform into the signal source: 15 
o DMRS signals for every odd resource element as described by section #1 for symbol #11 16

symbol #2 the PN sequence will be pierced by the DMRS signals. 19

symbol #11.  These sequences start in PRB 64 and continue to PRB 273. The sequence in symbol 21 
#11 will be pierced by DMRS signals. 22 
o The user data for sections number #5 and #6 are standard PN23 sequences only for these symbols 23 
and PRBs described in the table above. 24 
 Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a 25 
trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 26 
 Load C-Plane message described above on Test Equipment O-RU (TER). The C-Plane message will 27 
contain valid values in the following fields: 28 
 EAxC ID 29 
 Datadirection bit (Uplink) 30 
 Frame ID, subframeID, slotID, startsymbolID, and NumSymbol 31 
 SectionID must have a value 4095 32 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  33 
 Launch test to play the RF uplink frame after the C-Plane messages have been sent honoring timing 34 
windows  35 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna 36 
port  37 
 TER will arrange U-Plane messages according to time and frequency 38

 Extract Payload 40 
 Compare payload binary sequences  41 
 42 
c. Procedure for Coupling C and U plane messages via frequency and time with section priorities 43 
(optimized) 44 
This test will be identical to the above test with the following exceptions: 45 
 There will be two C-Plane messages describing the uplink and downlink signals to be sent. 46 
 The first two sections listed in the table above (those with higher priorities) will be repeated in both C-47 
Plane messages and will have a section ID equal to a value between 0 and “max-highest-priority-48 
sections-per-slot” as sent on the M-Plane. 49 
 The other sections will be divided between the two C-Plane messages and not repeated. 50 
 The repeated C-plane message will have the “repetition” bit set to one. 51

 53 

 
________________________________________________________________________________________________ 
Copyright © 2022 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V. 
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       303 
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v05.00 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  1 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 2 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 3 
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer must be the same as the signal described above.  It must contain 4 
all the same PRB assignments and PN23 sequences. 5 
3. The data received from the O-RU on the uplink U-Plane must match the uplink signal sent to the DUT 6 
including all the same PRB assignments and PN23 sequences. 7 
4. The beamweights or magnitude and phase relation at the antenna ports (or TAB connectors) of the test signal 8 
that achieves the highest performance (i.e. best EVM, power, SNR, etc.) should match with the manufacturer’s 9 
declaration of the beam under test.  The procedures for test case 3.2.3.2.4 (UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class 10 
Beamforming 3GPP UL – Predefined-beam Beamforming) and test case 3.2.3.2.3 (UC-Plane O-RU Scenario 11 
Class Beamforming 3GPP DL – Predefined-beam Beamforming) should be used. 12 
5. These expected results are applicable for either or both forms of this test. 13 
6. If all of the above results are observed the test passes. 14 
 15 
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using Non-contiguous PRB Allocation 16 
Section Extension using section extension 12 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation 17 
A. Test Description and Applicability 18 
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 19 
 20 
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 21 
section extension 12, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the 22 
downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with section extension 12.    This test 23 
uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 24 
 25 
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O-DU emulator 26 
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 27 
require the O-RU to transmit on thedownlink and uplink the specified signal using section extension 12 in both 28 
uplink and downlink.   29 
 30 
In this test stock data section definition C will be used to exercise the non-contiguous RB allocation, all 273 PRBs 31 
(48 of the 51 in the uplink slots) or the max number of PRBs per symbol for the highest numerology the radio 32 
supports will be used in this test. 33 
 34 
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 35 
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 36 
will also be a PN23 sequence. 37 
 38 
B. Test Entrance Criteria 39 
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  40 
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1  41 
for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for FR2.  It will 42 
be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. 43 
 44 
The radio must support section extension 12 as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the ability 45 
to decode the downlink shared channel. 46 
 47 
C. Test Methodology 48 
a. Initial Conditions 49 
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 50 
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 51 
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 52 
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna port and configure it as 53 
described below. 54 
b. Procedure 55 
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 56 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 57 
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 58

control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 1 
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, 2 
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  3

respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times 5 
required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the 6

transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, 8 
extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source. 9

starting PRB will be zero and number of PRBs will be 48.  The resource block group size will be 16.  Using the 15

symbol #6.  The symMask value should be set to 00000011000000b.  No section type zero messages will be 21

 1 Figure 3.2.6.1-2  Uplink C-Plane Parameters 2 
Steps: 3 
 Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  4 
 Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 5 
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  6 
 Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 7 
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal 8 
analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the frame. 9 
 Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 10 
Antenna port  11 
 Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 12 
 Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 13 
 Extract Payload for both signals 14 
 Compare payload binary sequences  15 
 16 
 17 
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  18 
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 19 
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 20 
2. The signal extracted by the U-Plane messages (uplink) should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 21 
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 22 
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 23 
all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 sequence as data, the downlink test passes. 24 
4. The test frame extracted from the uplink U-Plane messages should be the same as the uplink signal described 25 
above.  If it contains all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 sequence as data, the uplink test 26 
passes. 27
